intro: Corethrogyne viscidula, commonly known as the sticky corethrogyne, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its sticky, glandular hairs that cover its stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woods.
